intro: Paronychia capitata, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a rough texture. Paronychia capitata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
